alert.note: Alert for Marion; Morrow (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:33AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marion and Morrow Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1232 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near La Rue, or 7 miles west of Marion, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Mount Gilead, Cardington, Prospect, La Rue, Morral, Waldo, Chesterville, Caledonia, New Bloomington, Edison, Green Camp, Fulton, Iberia, Shauck and State Route 229 at US Route 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
